intro: Sterculia tubulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sterculia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It is often found in coastal areas and sandy soils, adapting well to saline environments. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its propagation in natural habitats.
